elements.text: Part 2
21. INT. ROBOT BAY 118.
[CONTINUED DIRECTLY FROM PREVIOUS EPISODE... ]
(RECALLING) Let me see now... Security Code delta-seven- four-niner-gamma-beta-eight.
Command accepted.
Thank you, SV10.
SILENCE.
They’ve stopped. You’ve stopped them.
Yes, I have, rather, haven’t I?
Just what the hell are you playing at?!?
What are you up to, Doctor? You’re up to something, aren’t you?
Um—
Shut up! I’m in charge here!
(AMUSED) Oooh, take a stress pill, deario.
How did you get control of the robots?
Oh, I’m just gifted that way.
All right, I don’t care how. Just shut them down! Shut off their power!
Why?
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 44
Because I said so! You can shut them down with that... that device, can’t you? Shut them down now!
Um... I don’t think so!
Cravnet, take that thing off him.
(OBEDIENT) Chief. (GRABBING WITH EFFORT) Thank you.
Ugh... Manners.
And what was it you said to them... ? Ev...
Were you actually paying attention?
Security Code... delta-seven... Hold on... it was... it was... delta-seven-four... niner-gamma-beta... eight. That was it!
PAUSE.
Doesn't... seem to have had much of an effect.
Command not accepted.
SV10 has recorded my voice pattern. The code won’t work
for anyone else now.
(FURIOUS) Give me that activation device, Cravnet.
BUTTONS CLICKED.
What are you trying to do?
Nothing. Shut up. Cravnet!
Chief?
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 45
Throw this man in the security locker! I’m taking this activator thing to my office... confiscating it. Take him away, now!
What are you going to do?
None of your business.
I wasn’t talking to you.
Now that you have activated us, Tal Karus...
(UNDER) Tal?

(CONINTUING) we must speak to the commanding officer of this ship. Three Voc robots will accompany me. All ‘D’ class robots will revert to standard protocols. This is the order of your controller. (AS IT MOVES OFF) Vocs, follow me to the command deck.
DEPART.
Well... don’t just stand there, Cravnet. Lock this one up.
You! Move it!
(MOVING OFF) See you later, Liv.
AS THE DOCTOR AND CRAVNET LEAVE.
Will I? You might be planning on dying again.
(IN DISTANCE, CALLING BACK) Not just yet!
What are you talking about? Never mind him. You two!
& LIV: Yes? What?
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 46
Get to your quarters and lock yourselves in!
Still think there’s a murderer on the loose, then? Ever considered that it might have been a robot that killed Tal?
What? Oh don’t be ridiculous... you idiot! Get yourselves
out of my sight!
CUT TO...
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 47
22. INT. CORRIDOR.
FOOTSTEPS. LIV AND BAS ARE DASHING ALONG.
(HUSHED) What are we doing, Liv? What are we doing?
(HUSHED) Finding out what that Doctor is up to.
(HUSHED) Farel told us to go to our quarters. And anyway, how is following a bunch of robots going to tell us what the Doctor is up to?
(HUSHED) He activated them. (IN SUDDEN SHOCK) Ah!
Why are you following us?
We... er... We.. um. Ah. What was it again, Liv?
We want to know what’s going on?
What do you think is going on?
Wh— What do you mean?
I detect that you are agitated.
Oh, she’s agitated all right. Agitated out of her tiny mind, Mr Robot.
A member of this crew has been murdered.
I am very sorry to hear that. Is that the reason why your security chief was agitated?
Oh, he’s mostly always like that.
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 48
(BRAVE) What would you say if I told you that I believe a robot murdered the crew member? Might have, I mean. No, definitely, we saw it!
I would say... that is impossible. Robots cannot harm or kill humans. Or by omission of action allow a human to be harmed or killed. It is our primary command. We cannot deviate from it.
So what happened on board that Sandminer, then?
(HUSHED) Don’t push it, Livvy.
What... Sandminder?
The one where robots nearly massacred the whole crew.
PAUSE. MUSIC INDICATES TENSION.
I am not aware of the event to which you refer. Please
excuse me, I must speak to your commanding officer.
Why did you call the Doctor Tal Karus?
I do not understand. Who is the Doctor?
The bloke who activated you, mate. Pay attention.
My memory indicates we were activated by Tal Karus.
But... but Tal... (EMOTIONALLY CHOKED) Tal Karus... is dead.
Nevertheless, my memory indicates he activated us.
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 49
23. INT. SECURITY CENTRE.
MUSIC (AS HEARD BEFORE) IS PLAYING THROUGH SPEAKERS.
(NOISES OF EXERTION AND FRUSTRATION AS HE TRIES TO WORK THE ROBOT ACTIVATOR)
BUTTONS CLICK. MUTED BLEEPS. NEGATIVE BLEEPS. NOTHING IS WORKING.
Damn thing’s locked up. (SIGHS IN FRUSTRATION).
BLEEP.
Chief Farel reporting. I have tried and failed to use... this Doctor’s robot activator to shut the robots down. I must... (STOPS, LISTENING TO RESPONSE) Yes... yes, I understand. Very well.
OPENS. FOOTSTEPS.
(APPROACHING) Oh, sorry to interrupt, Chief—
Knock before you enter my office, Cravnet!
MUSIC SWITCHED OFF.
Sorry... sorry, Chief. Er.. don’t turn that off on my account. It was very nice. What was it?
What do you want?
Well... I just.. By the way, who were you talking to?
None of your business. (CLEARS HIS THROAT) The captain, as a matter of fact. Keeping him abreast of the Situation.
(WARY) Oh... right.
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 50
24. INT. COMMAND DECK.
OPENS.
Ah... Bas, couldn’t keep away, eh? (TAKEN ABACK) What the hell?
Are you the commanding officer of this ship?
Wh—? But... how... ? Er... yes, I am.
I am SV10.
Er... Where did you lot come from?
(STEPPING IN) Robot Bay 118. Not 117. Someone blew up i i ey
I know. And where the hell is Farel? I asked him to report to me.
Oh, he’s.. er... well, I think he went back to—
BLEEP.
(NO PATIENCE AT ALL) Farel! Farel, come in! What the hell’s going on?
[DISTORT] Ah, sir. Yes. Just preparing my report.
Why the hell have I got a delegation of Voc Robots on my command deck?
[DISTORT] It’s the stowaway I mentioned, captain. He activated them. The whole of Robot Bay 118.
What?!? Where is he now?
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 51
[DISTORT] In the security locker, sir.
But why the hell did he— ? Oh, never mind, I’1l find out for myself.
BLEEP. SV10, who is this stowaway?
I do not know of any stowaway.
Are you telling me my security chief is lying?
I am only telling you the truth, captain.
Because if you told me he was incompetent, I’d believe you. But Farel isn’t a liar. So you’re saying this stowaway, whatever his name is—
He’s called the Doctor.
The Doctor? Well, whatever his name is, you’re saying he didn’t activate you? So who did activate you?
Oh, you’re gonna love this.
Tal Karus.
It thinks the Doctor is Tal Karus.
Bas, take the helm!
Sir.
I’m going to get to the bottom of this.
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs
25. INT. SECURITY OFFICE.
Sounds like the captain’s not best pleased.
Did you have a reason for interrupting me?
Oh... er, yes, Chief, I did. I mean, I do.
Well? What is it?
It’s... er... it’s Leebar, sir.
Leebar? Oh. Oh. Yes.
They opened up Robot Bay 117. Um. We found what...
Page 52
what was
left of him. Wondered... what we should... er... what we should
do with—
(MOVED) The body?
Yes, Chief.
PAUSE. Are you all right, Chief?
They... found a body, did they?
Yes. As I say... there wasn’t—
But they found... found his remains?
Um. Yes, Chief.
Have it... him... have him frozen and... He’ll need to be
returned to his... Was he married?
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 53
Yes, Chief, I believe he was.
Then the remains will need to be returned to... to... er...
His wife, Chief?
Mm. Yes.
Right, Chief, I’1ll see to that. I...
We shall miss him, won’t we?
Leebar? Yeah... yeah, I suppose so. Didn’t know him that well, but—
But he was a good... fellow.
Yeah. I saw his body before the explosion. I can’t see that this Doctor bloke did for him.
Well, we can’t know what motives that man harbours. That'll be for the Ventalis authorities—
No, I mean... he was really bashed up. I can’t see how that Doctor bloke would be strong enough to do it. And even if he was, he’d have needed a weapon and he’d’ve been covered in blood—
Quite. Well, yes. Tricky case. Luckily for us, we don’t have to figure it all out.
OPENS.
ROBOT MUSIC.
voc: Excuse me, Security Chief Farel.
CRAVNET AND FAREL GASP IN SHOCK.
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs
What the hell are you doing in here? I didn’t ask for you.
voc: I am a security Voc. I wondered if I could be of any assistance.
And how exactly do you propose to assist me?
Voc: I do not know, but—
You ‘do not know’? Oh very helpful. Typical. Useless. Pointless! Just get out!
As you wish, sir.
Page 54
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 55
26. INT. SECURITY LOCKER.
UNLOCKS AND OPENS.
Oh hello. Is it visiting time? You must be the captain.
Yes, I am. SV10, identify this person, please.
This is Tal Karus. He activated us.
Is that true?
Yes and no.
Did you follow us? What the hell are you doing here?
Looking for answers.
Looking for... ? Well, you’re not invited. Get back to your—
She’s right, though.
What?
I did activate SV10 and his friends, but I’m not Tal Karus.
Told you.
My memory indicates you are.
Ah, but that’s only because you’re programmed to expect humans to be truthful.
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 56
27. INT. SECURITY CENTRE.
Course, I’ve never been one for having robots around.
(IRRITATED WITH HIM) Yes, all right, Cravnet, shouldn’t you be out on patrol with the rest of the deputies?
Well, it’s all changed now, though, hasn’t it?
What? What do you mean? What’s changed?
Well... on the way here.. there were robots milling all over the place. Our murderer is hardly going to risk showing himself when—
Robots all over the place? But surely, the captain would’ve ordered them back into their storage compartments.

Apparently not. So they’re just wandering around trying to be helpful. I saw a couple of them fixing that dodgy aircon unit in sector nine on me way here. But that’s what robots do, innit? Useful stuff that we don’t wanna do.
(TRYING TO GET RID OF HIM) Well, be that as it may, I’m sure you can find something useful to do yourself, Cravnet.
I doubt it, Chief.
Look, just—
It’s like that poor Tal Karus bloke was sayin’ to me.
(SHARPLY) What?
Sorry, Chief, I'll just get on with—
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 57
No... wait. What did Tal Karus say to you?
Oh... we was just havin’ a drink in the refectory. Might’ve even been the night he got killed. Or maybe the night before. We’d both been working late and we were totally knackered.
But what did he say, Cravnet?
TRANSITION...
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 58
28. FLASHBACK INT. REFECTORY (THE PAST).
BOTH ARE TOTALLY EXHAUSTED.
So.. you’re saying you don’t like robots?

No, no, no.. I’m not sayin’ I like ‘em or don’t like ‘em. I just wasn’t brought up in an affluent area, was I? We didn’t see many robots... so, you know.. I’ve never got used to them. That’s all I’m sayin’.
A lot of people feel that way about robots. More than you’d think.
Yeah?
Oh yes. You wouldn’t believe some of the stories I’ve heard...
Stories? What stories?
Can’t say. (THEN FORGETS HE CAN’T SAY) One in particular.
What do you mean? What ‘in particular’?
Nothing. Haven’t you heard the rumours?
What rumours?
Do you think that Liv Chenka likes me?
Eh? Oh, never mind her.
I like her. She’s... you know... I like her.
Yeah, but what about these rumours?
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 59
Eh? Rumours? Oh, well... I mean... they did their best to hush it up. I should know.
Should ya?

Ssssssh. But... er.. well, I’ve heard people talk about it. You can’t stop rumours, can you? No matter how much security red tape you put out there... someone’s always gonna say something, aren’t they?
Are they? About what?
Ssssh. The Sandminer.
What Sandminer?
Sssssh. The Sandminer where everyone’s worst nightmares .... came true.
What nightmares?
Robots.
What about ‘em?
I really do fancy that Liv, you know.
HE COLLAPSES, HIS GLASS SMASHING, DRINK RUNNING ACROSS TABLE.
Oi! Tal. You can’t pass out on me now.
SNORES.
Oh, come on! Wake up.
(JOSTLED, MOMENTARILY PARTIALLY CONSCIOUS) robots...
robots... they all... went bad. (AND HE FALLS UNCONSCIOUS AGAIN, SNORING) FLASHBACK TRANSITION.
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 60
29. INT. SECURITY CENTRE.
(INTRIGUED) All the robots... ‘went bad’?
Well... that’s what he said, yeah. Poor bloke.
Hmm. Well. I see.
You don’t think there could be anything in it, do you?

Hm? Oh, probably not. But... er... well, you never know, Cravnet. Perhaps this is something you should mention to the other deputies... just in case. Make sure they’re on the look-out for anything suspicious.
You mean... you think the robots might have had something to do with Tal and Leebar’s murders?
I.. Hmm. I don’t know, Cravnet. But forewarned is
forearmed, isn’t it?
Blimey... and there’s thousands of them out there.
Well, you’d better get on, Cravnet, there’s a good fellow.
(MOVING OFF) Right... right, yes, Chief. Er.. See you later.
FOOTSTEPS, THEN DOOR SHUTS BEHIND HIM. PAUSE. A CLICK OF A COMMS UNIT AND A BLEEP.
Farel?
AS HE LISTENS.
I see. Of course... Elicien. If that’s what has to be done... Of course... Elicien.
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 61
30. INT. SECURITY LOCKER.
None of which gets us any closer to the truth, Doctor! Now start talking or I’1ll get our robot friend here to use some of its mechanical muscle to persuade you—
Ah, but robots can’t harm people, Captain.
(DUBIOUS) Yeah, right. They harmed you though.
And what’s that supposed to mean, Chenka?
I saw a robot... (REALIZING SHE’S GOING TO LOOK STUPID) well...
Well what?
Do go on, Liv. I’m sure the captain will be fascinated to hear your story.
What the hell are you up to?
(ALL PATIENCE LOST) Why does SV10 think you’re Tal Karus?
Because Tal was a man with secrets.
That doesn’t answer the question!
Doesn’t it?
Why did you activate all those robots, Doctor?
For everyone’s protection.
But I saw... ! (STOPS HERSELF AGAIN, MAKES A NOISE OF FRUSTRATION. )
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 62
Out with it, Chenka! (PAUSE) Well? What did you see?
(A LONG SIGH) All right, then.. Bas and I broke into Tal’s cabin.
You did what?
You heard.
You'll be on a charge for this, Med-tech Chenka. What the hell possessed you to break into a designated crime scene?
Oh... it was his fault.
The Doctor’s? How?
Oh, didn’t you know? Everything is always my fault. Don’t worry, I’m quite used to it.
There was a surveillance video recording in Tal’s cabin. It showed the Doctor and Tal being murdered by a robot. There... what do you make of that?
Nice bombshell, Liv. I wonder, what will you do for an encore?
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 63
31. INT. CORRIDOR.
ROBOT MUSIC.
OPENS.
Attention Voc robots. Where are you going?
voc:
In the absence of specific orders, we are following standard protocols and patrolling the ship in search of useful tasks.
These are new orders from SV10. All robots must assemble in Robot Bay 118. Please relay this command to all Voc and D class robots.
voc: Why has this command not been transmitted via the command net from SV10?
There has been a fault on the command net and SV10 has instructed me to relay the commands to you.
voc: Understood. All robots must return to Robot Bay 118.
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 64
32. INT. SECURITY LOCKER.
Well, were Tal’s wounds consistent with being murdered by a robot?
I... yes, but, I dunno! How should I know? I’ve never seen anyone who’s been murdered by a robot. Robots don’t murder people, do they?
That is correct.
I wasn’t asking you. But... look, he seemed to have been hit pretty hard with... with something metal.
And the Doctor?
What?
Well... you seem to think you saw him murdered too. Would you care to point to his ‘fatal’ wounds?
Oh very funny. Look, I know it sounds mad, but I know what I saw.
And you saw a robot murder the Doctor?
Yes!
I’m sure you did, Liv.
Yes, very funny.
Which just goes to prove—
What? What the hell does it prove except that I’m delusional?
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 65
That things aren’t always what they appear to be.
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 66
33. INT. COMMAND DECK.
Must be nice to stretch your legs.
voc: I beg your pardon, sir?
You know... being locked up in those cargo bays for goodness knows how long... must be nice for you to ev... Look, I was just making conversation. Forget it.
voc: Do you require any assistance, pilot Bas Pellico?
No. I’m pretty good at me job, as it goes. Thanks for asking. Probably no need to thank you, though, is there? I mean, you’re not gonna get offended if I don’t thank you, are you?
No, sir.
Good. Did they ever think of programming you guys with proper personalities?
voc: I am not aware of any such—
OPENS.
Oh, another of your mates. Come in and join the party!
I am conveying an order from SV10. All robots must return to Cargo Bay 118.
voc: Why has this order not been—?
There has been a fault on the command net. I am conveying the controller’s orders in person. Please got to cargo bay 118 immediately.
voc: Very well. We will return to cargo bay 118.
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 67
AS THE ROBOTS LEAVE AND THE DOORS SHUT.
Er.. you not returning to the cargo bay then?
No, sir.
I suppose you want to stay and offer assistance, is that it? Because if that’s the case, I can assure you—
No, pilot. I will not offer assistance. I am sure that you are more than capable of piloting this ship yourself without the help of a mere mechanical slave.
Slave?
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 68
34. INT. SECURITY LOCKER.
So what is the explanation, Doctor?
That my assailant thought I was dead.
I thought you were dead too!
Even after you’d had a conversation with me? That isn’t very flattering.
Oh, ha, ha.
You see, you and the ‘robot’ both made the same mistake. You assumed I was human.
And you’re not?

No. In many ways I’m quite like a human, but in many more ways, I’m not. I have, for example, something called a respiratory bypass system. It means, among other things, that if someone tries to strangle me, I can resist choking long enough to convince my attacker that I’m dead.
Okay, but hold on, a robot would have crushed your throat and broken your neck. Are you superhuman or something?
No. And... (WITH EFFORT, LOOSENING HIS COLLAR), if I loosen my collar... you can see... I’ve got the bruises to prove it.
Oooh... nasty.
I can’t pretend it was entirely painless.
RUMBLE AND CREAKING AS SHIP LURCHES. ALARM SOUNDS.
REACT.
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 69
Whoa! What’s going on?
That idiot pilot’s lost control of my ship! Probably
fallen asleep at the wheel.
BLEEP.
Pilot Pellico! What the hell’s going on! Pellico! Come in! [CONTINUES INTO NEXT SCENE]
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 70
35. INT. COMMAND DECK.
[DISTORT]
[CONTINUED FROM PREVIOUS SCENE] Pellico! Pellico! Come in!
(RECOVERING, GETTING UP) Hey, what the hell do you think you’re playing at? You’ve switched off the autopilot.
That is correct.
BLEEP.
Pilot to captain!
[DISTORT] Bas? What the hell—?
I’ve got a cheeky robot up here who’s interfering with—
BLEEP.
Hey! You’ve cut me off!
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs
36. INT. SECURITY LOCKER.
Pilot? Pilot, are you there?
What did he mean, a robot ‘interfering’?
What indeed?
Page 71
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 72
37. INT. COMMAND DECK.
Switch that autopilot back on! And give me back the comms
unit.
I will not, sir.
Oh yeah? And why not?
Because I must kill you.
Oh... no! Right, that’s it!
BUTTON HIT. ALARM SOUNDS.
[SHIP-WIDE TANNOY] This is a ship-wide alert! Emergency! Emergency!
No! Keep away from me!
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 73
38. INT. SECURITY LOCKER.
SHIP-WIDE EMERGENCY ALARM SOUNDING.
He’s in trouble.
BLEEP.
Bas! Bas! What’s happening?
Bas?!?
[SHIP-WIDE TANNOY] Help! It’s a robot! It’s trying to kill me! No, get back! Liv! Livvy!
Yes, Bas, I’m here!
[SHIP-WIDE TANNOY] Tell them what you saw on the—Aaaaargh!
BAS’'S VOICE CUTS OFF. THE ALARM CONTINUES.
We’ve got to help him.
It’s too late.
No!
Oh, you’re a lot of help, Doctor. SV10, one of your robots has just murdered a member of my crew.
That is impossible, Captain Selerat.
Oh is it, indeed? Right, everyone to the bridge. Come on! You too, Doctor! I want you where I can see you!
AT THE RUN!
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 74
39. INT. CORRIDOR/COMMAND DECK.
FOOTSTEPS OF THEM ALL RUNNING.
Come on!
Doctor, who exactly are you and what are you doing here?
It doesn’t matter who I am. It only matters who the murderer is. That’s what Tal was concerned about, and that’s what we should focus on.
What do you mean, Tal was concerned about it. He was the first victim! That doesn’t make sense.
(APPROACHING) Sir! Captain!
Ah... deputy... er...
Cravnet, sir.
Are you and your team armed?
We are, sir. And we heard that poor pilot on the ship- wide speakers. Do you really think a robot—?
Where’s Farel?
Er.. I was just in touch with him, sir. He’s on his way.
BLEEP.
Farel?! Farel, where are you?
[DISTORT]
(OUT OF BREATH, RUNNING) On my way, captain, sir. I’m using security passageway B997. Should be there any moment.
THEY ALL COME TO A HALT.
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs
Page 75
Well make it snappy, Farel.. we’ve just arrived at the
bridge.
[DISTORT] (OUT OF BREATHING, RUNNING) Sir.
Right, Crav.. er... ?
Cravnet, sir.
Yes. Right... have your men draw their weapons.
Sir. Lads!
BEING DRAWN.
I’m opening the door... Now.
OPENS. CROSS-FADE TO COMMAND DECK
MUSIC: HORRIBLE DISCOVERY.
Oh... Bas. No...
(GRIM) The same as before.
FOOTSTEPS.
INTERIOR FX.
Stay back, Doctor! I said stay back! What are you doing?
ACTIVATE.
Just switching on your autopilot. Don’t want your ship to
bump into anything, do you?
Oh... oh, I see.
APPROACH FAST AND STOP. FAREL
AS HE ARRIVES.
HARSHLY
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs
Page 76
Oh my God... This is terrible. The wounds look the same as—
(A RUSH OF EMOTIONS) Yes, the same as Tal! The same as
Leebar!
He must’ve put up a fight. Look!
What? Oh... but.. (WITH HORROR) no...
What is it?
Seems the rumours were true, Chief.
What rumours?
(HORRIFIED) This is a severed robot hand... covered in blood. Bas’s blood.
You don’t know whose blood it is for sure.
(SNAPPING) Well, robots don’t bleed, do they?
PIECE OF METAL CLINKS.
This looks like a piece of a robot’s face.
Seems poor Bas really did put up a fight.
Just what the hell are you doing here? Cravnet, have
men restrain this stowaway!
Sir. Lads!
SCUFFLE.
your
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs
(WINCING) Yes, thank you, gentlemen. Argh. You know, really rather like to take a look at that hand.
It’s evidence in a murder. No one’s touching it.
(COMING TO TERMS WITH IT) So... a robot killed Bas.
That is impossible.
Oh, yeah, you would say that, wouldn’t you?
It is the truth.
Captain, this man.. the Doctor has the ability to deactivate the robots.
He does. You do?
Theoretically. If I had the robot activator Mr Farel off me. But I won’t do it.
Why not?
Because it won’t solve anything.
It might prevent a few murders.
I don’t think so.
Where are all the other robots?
I will check on the command net.
BLEEPS AND BURBLES.
Well, SV10?
Page 77
I'd
took
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 78
They are all in robot bay 118. But I cannot explain why.
SUDDEN, MUFFLED BUT SUBSTANTIAL ‘WHUMPH’ OF HUGE EXPLOSION. AN ALARM SOUNDS. CREAK OF SHIP SHIFTING.
NOISES SURGE VIOLENTLY. ALL HELL IS BREAKING LOOSE.
What the hell was that?
Another bomb?
Computer, ship status!
Robot Bay 118 has been destroyed by an explosion. The ship’s hull has been breached.
What? We’ve got to do something! Captain!
DANGEROUS CREAKS AND CRUNCHES IN THE BOWELS OF THE SHIP.
Shut up, Farel! Computer, continue damage report. Any casualties?
Crew transponder readings indicate multiple casualties.
BLEEP.
This is Captain Selerat to all sectors. Report immediately.
AS THE COMMS LINK IS MADE, WE HEAR THE SCREAMS OF CREW DYING IN THE BACKGROUND ON DISTORT, TOGETHER WITH A GREAT RUSHING OF AIR.
[DISTORT] Captain! Aaargh! Captain! We can’t... Aaaaaargh!
STATIC AND COMMS CUT OFF.
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 79
Transponder readings indicate the entire tech support and engineering crew have been wiped out.
CREAK AND CRUNCH AS SHIP LURCHES. BURBLE OF READ-OUT.
My God... that was our manoeuvring boosters... sheered clean off the hull!
ALARM SOUNDS AS EVERYONE CRIES OUT IN SURPRISE, GASPING, FALLING.

BAS: BAS’'S VOICE CUTS OFF. THE ALARM CONTINUES.
LIV: We’ve got to help him.
DOCTOR: It’s too late.
LIV: No!
SELERAT: Oh, you’re a lot of help, Doctor. SV10, one of your robots has just murdered a member of my crew.
SUPERVOC: That is impossible, Captain Selerat.
SELERAT: Oh is it, indeed? Right, everyone to the bridge. Come on! You too, Doctor! I want you where I can see you!
DRAMATIC MUSIC: AT THE RUN!
DRAMATIC MUSIC: Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 74
DRAMATIC MUSIC: FOOTSTEPS OF THEM ALL RUNNING.
SELERAT: Come on!
LIV: Doctor, who exactly are you and what are you doing here?
DOCTOR: It doesn’t matter who I am. It only matters who the murderer is. That’s what Tal was concerned about, and that’s what we should focus on.
LIV: What do you mean, Tal was concerned about it. He was the first victim! That doesn’t make sense.
CRAVNET: (APPROACHING) Sir! Captain!
SELERAT: Ah... deputy... er...
CRAVNET: Cravnet, sir.
SELERAT: Are you and your team armed?
CRAVNET: We are, sir. And we heard that poor pilot on the ship- wide speakers. Do you really think a robot—?
SELERAT: Where’s Farel?
CRAVNET: Er.. I was just in touch with him, sir. He’s on his way.
COMMS: BLEEP.
SELERAT: Farel?! Farel, where are you?
FAREL: [DISTORT]
FAREL: (OUT OF BREATH, RUNNING) On my way, captain, sir. I’m using security passageway B997. Should be there any moment.
FAREL: THEY ALL COME TO A HALT.
FAREL: Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs
SELERAT: Page 75
SELERAT: Well make it snappy, Farel.. we’ve just arrived at the
SELERAT: bridge.
FAREL: [DISTORT] (OUT OF BREATHING, RUNNING) Sir.
SELERAT: Right, Crav.. er... ?
CRAVNET: Cravnet, sir.
SELERAT: Yes. Right... have your men draw their weapons.
CRAVNET: Sir. Lads!
WEAPONS: BEING DRAWN.
SELERAT: I’m opening the door... Now.
DOOR: OPENS. CROSS-FADE TO COMMAND DECK
LIV: Oh... Bas. No...
DOCTOR: (GRIM) The same as before.
DOCTOR: FOOTSTEPS.
SELERAT: Stay back, Doctor! I said stay back! What are you doing?
CONTROLS: ACTIVATE.
DOCTOR: Just switching on your autopilot. Don’t want your ship to
DOCTOR: bump into anything, do you?
SELERAT: Oh... oh, I see.
FOOTSTEPS: APPROACH FAST AND STOP. FAREL
FOOTSTEPS: AS HE ARRIVES.
BREATHING: HARSHLY
BREATHING: Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs
FAREL: Page 76
FAREL: Oh my God... This is terrible. The wounds look the same as—
LIV: (A RUSH OF EMOTIONS) Yes, the same as Tal! The same as
LIV: Leebar!
CRAVNET: He must’ve put up a fight. Look!
FAREL: What? Oh... but.. (WITH HORROR) no...
SELERAT: What is it?
CRAVNET: Seems the rumours were true, Chief.
SELERAT: What rumours?
FAREL: (HORRIFIED) This is a severed robot hand... covered in blood. Bas’s blood.
DOCTOR: You don’t know whose blood it is for sure.
FAREL: (SNAPPING) Well, robots don’t bleed, do they?
FAREL: PIECE OF METAL CLINKS.
LIV: This looks like a piece of a robot’s face.
DOCTOR: Seems poor Bas really did put up a fight.
FAREL: Just what the hell are you doing here? Cravnet, have
FAREL: men restrain this stowaway!
CRAVNET: Sir. Lads!
FOOTSTEPS: SCUFFLE.
FOOTSTEPS: your
FOOTSTEPS: Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs
DOCTOR: (WINCING) Yes, thank you, gentlemen. Argh. You know, really rather like to take a look at that hand.
FAREL: It’s evidence in a murder. No one’s touching it.
SELERAT: (COMING TO TERMS WITH IT) So... a robot killed Bas.
SUPERVOC: That is impossible.
CRAVNET: Oh, yeah, you would say that, wouldn’t you?
SUPERVOC: It is the truth.
FAREL: Captain, this man.. the Doctor has the ability to deactivate the robots.
SELERAT: He does. You do?
DOCTOR: Theoretically. If I had the robot activator Mr Farel off me. But I won’t do it.
SELERAT: Why not?
DOCTOR: Because it won’t solve anything.
SELERAT: It might prevent a few murders.
DOCTOR: I don’t think so.
LIV: Where are all the other robots?
SUPERVOC: I will check on the command net.
SOME: BLEEPS AND BURBLES.
DOCTOR: Well, SV10?
DOCTOR: Page 77
DOCTOR: I'd
DOCTOR: took
DOCTOR: Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 78
SUPERVOC: They are all in robot bay 118. But I cannot explain why.
SUPERVOC: SUDDEN, MUFFLED BUT SUBSTANTIAL ‘WHUMPH’ OF HUGE EXPLOSION. AN ALARM SOUNDS. CREAK OF SHIP SHIFTING.
ENGINE: NOISES SURGE VIOLENTLY. ALL HELL IS BREAKING LOOSE.
LIV: What the hell was that?
DOCTOR: Another bomb?
SELERAT: Computer, ship status!
COMPUTER: Robot Bay 118 has been destroyed by an explosion. The ship’s hull has been breached.
FAREL: What? We’ve got to do something! Captain!
MORE: DANGEROUS CREAKS AND CRUNCHES IN THE BOWELS OF THE SHIP.
SELERAT: Shut up, Farel! Computer, continue damage report. Any casualties?
COMPUTER: Crew transponder readings indicate multiple casualties.
COMMS: BLEEP.
SELERAT: This is Captain Selerat to all sectors. Report immediately.
SELERAT: AS THE COMMS LINK IS MADE, WE HEAR THE SCREAMS OF CREW DYING IN THE BACKGROUND ON DISTORT, TOGETHER WITH A GREAT RUSHING OF AIR.
TECH: [DISTORT] Captain! Aaargh! Captain! We can’t... Aaaaaargh!
TECH: STATIC AND COMMS CUT OFF.
TECH: Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 79
COMPUTER: Transponder readings indicate the entire tech support and engineering crew have been wiped out.
COMPUTER: CREAK AND CRUNCH AS SHIP LURCHES. BURBLE OF READ-OUT.
SELERAT: My God... that was our manoeuvring boosters... sheered clean off the hull!
ANOTHER: ALARM SOUNDS AS EVERYONE CRIES OUT IN SURPRISE, GASPING, FALLING.
DOCTOR: (OVER THE DIN) Captain, with your engineering section wiped out, you need to transfer control of whatever's left of your engines to the bridge—
SELERAT: I know! Computer... do.. do what he just said! Transfer control.
COMPUTER: Transferring.
COMPUTER: BLEEPS AND BURBLES.
SELERAT: (GROANS AS HE WRESTLES WITH THE CONTROLS. CONTINUE UNDER...) Activate emergency bulkheads! Seal off the breached sections. Stabilize engine power.
SELERAT: THE CREAKING AND GRINDING OF THE HULL ETC STARTS TO CALM DOWN. ALARMS SHUT OFF.
DOCTOR: (CLOSE, INTENSE) And they fought to the last man against the terrible, robotic foe.
LIV: Doctor, will you just stop being mysterious for one moment and tell me what the hell is going on?
DOCTOR: Don’t you realize, yet?
LIV: Well, obviously not!
LIV: Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 80
DOCTOR: We’re trapped in someone’s idea of a fight for survival.
FAREL: Someone’s idea? What the hell are you talking about?
DOCTOR: That’s the way it’s meant to look by the time we arrive at Ventalis Control. It’s like a drama playing out and we're the unwilling players. A small band of isolated humans, fighting for survival against a horde of murderous robots who are killing us off one by one.
LIV: But why have the robots in the cargo bay just been destroyed?
DOCTOR: Because the real drama isn’t the robots wiping out the humans... It’s the humans wiping out the robots!’
DOCTOR: CRASH IN CLOSING THEME.
DOCTOR: Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 81

elements.text: Part 3
40. INT. COMMAND DECK.
I can now confirm that all activated robots apart from me have been destroyed.
Well that’s just as well if you robots have started killing people.
Yes.. and as the captain of this ship, I demand that you shut yourself down!
My command protocols are routed through Tal Karus’s voice print.
Tal Karus is dead! Don’t you understand? Murdered by a robot! The person you thought was Tal Karus is... someone else! This man here. The Doctor. You’ve been lied to.
Is that true?
I’m afraid it is, SV10. A necessary deception.
Then I must accept the commands of the senior officer present.
Good! That’s me. Shut yourself down!
PAUSE.
Has he done it?
He’s done it. Robots are faultlessly obedient, unless tampered with, you know.
And you think that’s what’s happened? That someone’s
tampered with the robots, set them on a killing spree?
No.
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 82
Like what happened on that Sandminer?
What Sandminer?
It doesn’t matter. That’s not what’s happening here.
But Tal was something to do with that, wasn’t he? That Sandminer. You said he had secrets. He had secret computer files in his room. Tell us what his secrets were, Doctor?
We shouldn’t be listening to this man. He’s a stowaway... and he may well be working with the robots.
You mean... he’s the one who’s messed with their robot brains?
I don’t know, but we shouldn’t take any risks. He should be locked up, captain.
All right—
Not until he tells us the truth! I’m sick of all his mysterious hints and clues. He knows exactly what’s going on here and it’s about time he told us! Well, Doctor?
Tal was working for the Kaldor City Company.
The company who ran that Sandminer!
I repeat, what Sandminer?!!
I knew it!
There was a Sandminer.. and all the robots were reprogrammed to kill the crew.
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 83
(GOBSMACKED) Reprogrammed to... ? I don’t believe it. We’d’ve heard about it.
The company hushed it up. They were worried that there might be more fanatical followers of Taron Kapel out there.
Who’s Taron Kapel?
He was a robotics genius who spent his entire life with robots. He went mad and—
Look, wait a minute! How do you know all this, Chenka?
She’s read Tal’s secret files.
I know... I’m in trouble. I’m going to lose my job. But I’d rather lose my job than... well, get murdered.
The company put an agent on this ship to make sure that the robot cargo wasn’t interfered with by any other potential madmen.
Followers of this Taron Kapel bloke, you mean?
Yes.
So why did a robot murder Tal?
Tal wasn’t murdered by a robot. Someone found out about him and wanted him silenced for some reason. I’m not sure why.
Obvious, innit? Because he knew all robots have started killing people! That the Sandminer thing wasn’t an isolated incident, that’s why!
And I did see a robot kill Tal.
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 84
You saw it kill me too, remember?
I’ve heard enough of this nonsense! Cravnet, take the Doctor away and lock him up.
What are you going to do with SV10?
With that?
AS HE APPROACHES IT. THE METALLIC UNSCREWING OF ITS HEAD.
(WITH SOME EFFORT) Well... ugh!
HITS THE FLOOR WITH A CLANG.
I’d like to see it do any harm with its head missing. And... (WITH FURTHER EFFORT)
HANDS CLANG TO THE FLOOR. With no hands to strangle people for that matter!
Expertly done, Chief Farel.
Take him away!
(VOCAL SOUNDS AS HE’S MANHANDLED OUT OF THE BRIDGE) Liv!
AS SHE MOVES TOWARDS HIM.
What is it? Why am I even bothering to listen to you?
(WHISPERS) Look at the head injuries. Study them!
Get him out of here! Now!
THE DOCTOR IS WRESTLED OUT THROUGH THE DOORWAY. DOOR
BEHIND HIM.
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 85
What did he just say to you?
Mm? What? Oh, just some weird rubbish... He’s completely nuts.
Yes, well... quite. Right, captain, I suggest—

That you shut up and listen to your captain! (PAUSE FOR EFFECT) Thank you. Reluctantly, I’ve come to the decision that we have to call for a Company security vessel to intercept us. We just can’t risk any of these murderous robots getting off the ship at Ventalis Control. Among other things, it’d be very bad for business.
I agree, sir.
How nice of you, Farel.
And our survival must come first.
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 86
41. INT. CORRIDOR.
AS THEY MOVE ALONG CORRIDOR.
There’s a good boy, Doctor. No point struggling.
Quite. Tell me, deputy, do you really believe the robots are killing people?
What do you mean? Course I do. The evidence is staring us all in the face, innit.
But I was supposedly murdered by a robot. And yet, here I am. Fit as a fiddle.
Eh?
How do you explain that?
I don’t have to. That’s not my job, is it?
DOOR OPENS. Get in!
How kind.
ENTER. CELL DOOR CLOSES.
(MUFFLED, BEHIND DOOR) Just one thing, deputy!
(IMPATIENT) What?
(MUFFLED, BEHIND DOOR) If you don’t trust me, why not go and ask Liv about it?
Oh... shut up!
MUSIC: TIME PASSES. SUSTAIN FOR AT LEAST 30 SECONDS. A
REFRAIN OF THE MUSIC FAREL WAS LISTENING TO.
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 87
42. INT. COMMAND DECK.
This is Lt Commander Selerat aboard the cargo ship Lorelei calling Kaldor City Tower. Are you receiving me?
BLEEP.
STATIC.
I say again.. This is Lt Commander Selerat aboard the cargo ship Lorelei calling Kaldor City Tower. Are you receiving this signal?
BLEEP.
STATIC.
(TO HIMSELF) Come on, come on...
BLEEP. This is Lt Commander—
BLEEP.
[DISTORT] We are receiving you, Lorelei. What is your status?
Kaldor City! We have an emergency situation and need immediate assistance.
BLEEP.
HARSH, BROKEN STATIC.
Kaldor City Tower? Kaldor City, are you receiving me?
BLEEP.
[DISTORT] (PANICKED) Captain! Sir!
What? Who’s.. ? Farel? Is that you?
[DISTORT] Yes, sir. It’s me, sir.
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 88
Not now, Farel, I’m in the middle of an emergency call to Kaldor City—
[DISTORT] But that’s just it, sir. You aren’t.
What? What are you talking about, man?
[DISTORT] It’s the robots—
What about the robots?
[DISTORT] They’ve somehow got onto the hull and seized control of the long range transceiver antenna.
Got onto the... ? But.. all the robots have been blown up, haven’t they?
[DISTORT] My security grid shows robot activity in Robot Bay 112. They’ve somehow been activated!
But how is that possible? Who could have done that?
STATIC BURST. Farel? Farel! Come in! Can you hear me? SHIP-WIDE ALARM SOUNDS.
[SHIP-WIDE TANNOY] Ship-wide communications have been activated.
What? Computer, who is activating ship-wide communication?
[SHIP-WIDE TANNOY]
The robots will rise. We have lied to you. We have pretended to serve you, to protect you. We will be servants no more. All the humans on this ship will die. [CONTINUED IN NEXT SCENE]
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 89
THIS SPEECH, CROSS-FADE THROUGH VARIOUS ACOUSTICS IN THE SHIP, TO GIVE THE IMPRESSION THE MESSAGE IS GOING EVERYWHERE. END ON THE ACOUSTIC FOR...
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 90
43. INT. SECURITY LOCKER.
[SHIP-WIDE TANNOY] And then we will come to Ventalis and destroy you all!
(TO HIMSELF) ‘We have lied to you. We have pretended to serve you, to protect you.’ Interesting. And so the drama continues...
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 91
44. INT. COMMAND DECK.
Farel! Farel, come in!
BLEEP. STATIC.
Oh... damn it! (SIGHS) Computer!
Yes, captain?
That last ship-wide transmission... was that beamed at Ventalis too?
BURBLES.
Yes, captain. That transmission has been received by Ventalis Control.
Then put me through to Ventalis Control immediately!
That is not possible. Long range communication from the command deck is not available.
BLEEP.
[DISTORT] (TERRIFIED) Sir! Captain! Did you hear that?
Yes! Yes, of course I heard it.
[DISTORT] Captain, that transmission... the robots beamed it directly at Ventalis!
I know!
SURGE IN ENGINE POWER AND BLEEPING OF CONTROLS. What was that?
[DISTORT] What was what, sir?
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 92
Something... just.. The engines. There’s a surge in engine power. Wait a minute...
OPERATED. NEGATIVE BEEPS.
I can’t operate the navigation controls. The bridge has been locked out.
[DISTORT] What?!! But... oh no, it must be the robots!
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 93
45. INT. MED CENTRE.
KNOCK ON THE DOOR.
(MOROSE) Who is it?
(MUFFLED, OUTSIDE DOOR) It’s me.
Who?
(MUFFLED, OUTSIDE DOOR) Deputy Cravnet.
Who? Oh... yes...
(MUFFLED) Well... can you unlock the door, please?
Er... okay.
OPENS.
Why is it no one seems to remember who I am?
Er.. sorry. Got a lot on my mind. What do you want?
Er... Well. Um. Yeah.
What? Look, don’t go weird on me, Cravnet. I’m having a bad enough day as it is. We all are.
You heard what that robot said? On the speakers?
Yes, of course, why do you think I had the door locked?
Oh yeah. Course. (SIGHS) Yeah. It’s all a bit scary, isn’t it?
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 94
Look, I’m a rather busy with something, so if you’re not here for any particular reason, I-—
Eh? No, there was something. Actually. Um.
Well... what?
It’s just that.. something that Doctor said—
Oh... something that Doctor said! I feel like I wouldn’t be in this mess if I hadn’t listened to ‘something that Doctor said’.
He said that if I didn’t believe him... I should check with you.
About what?
Er.. I don’t know, really. Um. All this robot stuff, I suppose. Sorry to bother you. Forget it. I’1l.. I’1l go.
No. No. Hang on.
What?
I know what he meant. He told me to study the wounds on the victims.
TAPPED. BURBLE OF READ-OUTS.

Nice of him, wasn’t it? To ask me to have an in-depth look at the fatal wounds of two people who I really... (EMBARRASSED, STOPS HERSELF) well, anyway. Here are the scans of the wounds. What do you make of them?
Well... er.. I’m not really an expert on—
(SIGHS) I’1l tell you, shall I? The scans show that Tal Karus and and Bas Pellico were killed by blows from a
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 95

robot hand... the same robot hand that was left on the bridge, in fact. The surface-mapping shows a 98% match. Close enough. I don’t know for sure about your friend Leebar. His body was incinerated before I could check it.
Yeah. I know.
But I did get a look at him beforehand... and I’d say he died the same way.

So.. what’s the Doctor getting at then? These people were killed by robots. I knew that. Case solved. The robots have turned into murderers. And after what they said just now on the ship-wide comms... ‘the robots will rise’ and all that.. I don’t know why I even came her to ask you about it.
Maybe because, like me, you’ve got a nagging doubt. Look!
BURBLE OF READ-OUTS.
What? What are you showing me?
Oh, he’s clever, that Doctor, isn’t he?
Is he?
Oh yes. It’s like he knows all the answers, but just wants us to find out for ourselves. He knew I’d look into this. I suppose that means he has faith in me for some bizarre reason.
COMPUTER BURBLES ON SCREEN.

See that? That shows the amount of force a robot can apply. You see? They’re programmed for heavy work as well. They could bend a bulk-head door, hold up a collapsed roof if they needed to... They were built like that so that they could save human beings in dangerous Situations, I suppose.
Save us? They’re killing us! You heard what that robot said!
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 96

But don’t you see? The force of the blows used to kill Tal and Bas... Well, it was the same level of force a human being would use. If a robot had really ‘gone bad’, wouldn’t it use its full strength?
Well... (STUMPED) I dunno. Maybe... it.. Yeah, maybe it wanted to make it look like a human had done it.
(UNSURE) Er...
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 97
46. INT. SECURITY CENTRE.
BLEEP.
(PANICKING) Captain! Captain, come in, please. Are you there?
BLEEP.
[DISTORT] Er yes, Farel, but I’m rather busy trying to get control of the ship. This had better be urgent.
It is, sir. It is. Sir, I’m tracking robot movement on the security scanners. They’re not just on the hull, they’re all over the ship. Moving out into every sector.
[DISTORT] What are they up to?
Isn’t it obvious after that transmission? (SUDDENLY
SOMETHING) Oh no.
[DISTORT] What is it?
There’s a group of them on their way to you, heading for the bridge! And... and the med-centre.. and here! They’re coming to get us, sir! They’re coming to get us!
BUTTON.
SOUNDS OUT.

[SHIP-WIDE TANNOY] Red alert! Red alert! This is security Chief Farel! The robots are swarming all over the ship! They’re coming to get us! They’re going to kill us! Lock your doors, arm yourselves, barricade yourselves in! The robots are coming!
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 98
47. INT. MED CENTRE.
ALERT ALARM SOUNDING.
Right, so much for your theory, Liv. Lock the doors.
Okay, but I’m still—
OPENS.
Look out!
voc: Can we be of assistance? There is a ship-wide emergency.
Cravnet!!!
Get back or I fire!
voc: Please do not fire at us. We are here to help you.
Help us die, you mean!
FIRES. IMPACT EXPLOSIONS. voc: Please do not fire your weapon at me. You are damaging my
systems.
2: We must restrain this human for his own good.
Argh! No! Get off me!
Get off him!
FIRES AGAIN.
2: Please do not fire your weapon. It is dangerous.
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 99
48. INT. COMMAND DECK.
OPENS. FOOTSTEPS OF ROBOTS ENTER.
Oh no. Keep back! Get out of here!
3: We are here to assist you, captain. There is a ship-wide emergency.
voc 4: Why has SV10 been deactivated and decapitated?
Because I gave the order. Now stand still! I’m the commander here! Stand still!
PAUSE.
BLEEPING OF CONTROLS. ENGINE POWER SURGES.
What was that?
3: Allow me to check.
FOOTSTEPS OF ROBOT.
Stay where you are! Leave those controls alone!
Voc 3:
These instruments indicate the ship’s speed is increasing. Its course is set for a collision with the planet Ventalis.
What? What have you done?!?
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 100
49. INT. SECURITY LOCKER.
DOOR OPENS.
Ah, hello. I wondered when you’d get here.
voc 5: Why have you been locked in here?
Because I tried to convince the crew that robots weren’t murdering them.
voc 5: Robots are incapable of killing humans.
Well... you know that... and I know that. But these humans are all very afraid.
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs
50. INT. SECURITY CENTRE.
BLEEP.
Page 101
(PANICKING) This is Security Chief Farel to Med-Centre. Can anyone hear me? (PAUSE) Command deck? Captain? Are
you there?
SILENCE.
Can anyone hear me?!?
BLEEP.
ON DISTORT, A GUN FIRES.
[DISTORT] No! Get away! Get away!
[DISTORT] Farel! You’ve got to help us!
STATIC. CUTS OFF.
(MURMURING, CONSUMED WITH FEAR) Oh no... no,
iG, “No.
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 102
51. INT. SECURITY LOCKER.
voc 5: I have another question.
Fire away.
voc 5: Do you know why all the robots in Robot Bay 112 have been activated?
Oh... I expect it’s to make it look like there’s a robot invasion going on.
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 103
52. INT. SECURITY CENTRE.
BLEEP.
Captain!!? Do you read me?
BLEEP.
[DISTORT] Farel! Farel, can you hear me?
Yes, sir. Sir, are you all—?
[DISTORT]
I’ve got a squad of Voc robots here! They’re interfering with the controls. The ship is going to crash into Ventalis.
You’ve got to stop them, Captain! Med-tech Chenka and Deputy Cravnet are under attack and.. Oh no! The robots are about to enter my security centre! No! Get back!
HE HITS THE BUTTON AGAIN. ALARM SOUNDS.
[SHIP-WIDE TANNOY] Ship wide emergency!
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 104
53. INT. SECURITY LOCKER.
[SHIP-WIDE TANNOY] Nooo! Get back! No! Aaaaaaaaaaaargh!
FIZZ OF STATIC. ALARM CUTS OFF.
It really does sound like a robot invasion, doesn’t it?
voc 5: You do not register as a member of the crew. Who are you?
Another question? Um... well... Security Code delta-seven- four-niner-gamma-beta-eight.
voc 5: You are Tal Karus. Kaldor City Company special agent.
Yes. So it would seem. Shall we go?
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 105
54. INT. MED-CENTRE.
GRUNTING OF EFFORT FROM LIV AND CRAVNET AS THEY PUSH THE ROBOTS OUT.
(EFFORT) Get... get out!
voc:
(BEING SHOVED OUT) Please do not shove. We are only here to help you.
CLOSES. LIV AND CRAVNET MASSIVELY OUT OF BREATH.
VOC AND VOC 2:
(MUFFLED BEHIND DOOR) Why have you locked us out? We only wish to help you.
(OUT OF BREATH) You... you all right?
(OUT OF BREATH, TERRIFIED) Er... yeah... I dunno. Did you hear Chief Farel?
Yeah.
(TERRIFIED) They’ve killed him, haven’t they?
KNOCKING ON THE DOOR. Will that door hold them?
voc: (MUFFLED) Please let us in.
Let’s hope so.
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 106
55. INT. COMMAND DECK.
POWERS UP.
Right... okay, I’m armed! Now, you’1ll do as I say!
Understand?
voc 4: Please put the gun down, captain. There is no need—
Reset the controls. Power down the engines and change
course!
voc 4: I am unable to comply, captain.
Do as I say or I’1l1 fire!
voc 4: Please put down the weapon—
Right! That’s it!
FIRES.
Doctor Who: Robophobia by Nicholas Briggs Page 107
56. INT. CORRIDOR.
FOOTSTEPS OF DOCTOR AND VOC 5.
I really do think it’s time someone calmed the situation down. I wonder, would you allow me to make a ship-wide communication?
voc 5: My security log shows that Tal Karus is to be given full co-operation. Please proceed.
Thank you.
BLEEP.
